snippet: To improve wages and working conditions at Bangladeshi and other Asian factories, the United States should bring down high tariffs on imports.
abstract: Op-Ed article by political scientist Sanchita B Saxena contends garment factory fire in Bangladesh serves as reminder of human costs of producing and consuming cheap goods; calls on United States to bring down high tariffs on imports, which put pressure on contractors in Bangladesh and other Asian countries to scrimp on labor standards in order to stay competitive.
lead_paragraph: To improve wages and working conditions at Bangladeshi and other Asian factories, the United States should bring down high tariffs on imports.
